docs.title: Modern Data Stack Insights for Developers
Description
docs.text:
It is an AI-powered GitHub app designed to streamline code reviews and enhance the integrity of your data flows. By automatically analyzing pull requests, the app provides real-time insights into the impact of code changes across the modern data stack, covering tools like Fivetran, dbt, Looker, and Lightdash. With built-in technical impact analysis, it highlights functional dependencies and potential downstream effects of changes, helping data teams prevent issues early in the development process.

Info

After installing the app, it will take a little time to initialize before you can view insights across your data stack. If you have any questions please feel free to contact us at hello@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text:
If you would like to use API to connect integrations or enable notifications, call our API with the required details. You can use any REST API client or refer to the instructions on the following page - https://insights.cloudavenue.ai/api/docs

How to get YOUR_ORG_NAME and INSTALLATION_ID

Navigate to GitHub intalled apps and click configure Cloud Avenue Data Insights. You should be able to see owner and installation ID as part of the URL.

docs.title: Integrations
Notifications
Step 1
docs.text: Follow this link to install our GitHub app - https://github.com/apps/cloud-avenue-data-insights

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Choose repositories you want to get insights for. We support repos with Node.JS, Debezium, dbt, and Looker code. If you would like us to support any other technology please feel free to send a note to hello@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To configure additional features, e.g. to gain insights from platforms without GitHub repositories or enable notifications, create an account and configure them through our portal https://insights.cloudavenue.ai/ or via API following the instructions below. While on the GitHub app configuration page, capture your organization name and installation ID. Both details can be found in the URL - https://github.com/organizations/<YOUR_ORG_NAME>/settings/installations/<INSTALLATION_ID>
